meanings.definition: Capable of being molded or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The soft clay was fictile and easily molded into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The artist used fictile material to create a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The fictile clay seemed to enjoy being transformed into various forms.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was as fictile as the clay in the potter's hands.
meanings.sent5: The fictile nature of the material allowed for endless creativity.

meanings.definition: Made of clay or other materials that can be easily shaped.
meanings.sent1: The fictile vase was delicately crafted by skilled hands.
meanings.sent2: Children enjoy playing with fictile toys that can be molded into different figures.
meanings.sent3: The fictile bowl giggled as it was shaped on the potter's wheel.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as fictile as the clay, ready to be molded by love.
meanings.sent5: The fictile nature of the material made it perfect for crafting pottery.

meanings.definition: Able to be formed into a desired shape.
meanings.sent1: The fictile material could be easily transformed into any form the artist desired.
meanings.sent2: The fictile substance was ideal for creating custom-made molds.
meanings.sent3: The fictile clay happily cooperated as it was shaped into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as fictile as the clay, ready to take any shape.
meanings.sent5: The fictile quality of the material allowed for precise sculpting.
